name: University of Tokyo
description: The University of Tokyo is Japan's leading research institution, consistently ranked among the world's top universities. It offers comprehensive programs across sciences, humanities, and engineering.
languageRequirements: Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) N2 or higher for some programs
otherRequirements: Statement of purpose and recommendation letters

name: Kyoto University
tagline: Spirit of Freedom and Academic Excellence
description: Kyoto University is renowned for its research-oriented approach and has produced numerous Nobel laureates. The university emphasizes independent thinking and academic freedom.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with strong academic record

name: Osaka University
description: Osaka University is a leading comprehensive research university with strengths in sciences, engineering, and medicine. It actively promotes international collaboration and student exchange.
academicRequirements: Completion of 12 years of formal education
languageRequirements: JLPT N2 or equivalent for certain programs

name: Tokyo Institute of Technology
description: Tokyo Institute of Technology specializes in science and engineering education and research. It's Japan's top technical university with cutting-edge facilities and industry partnerships.
academicRequirements: Strong background in mathematics and sciences
Entrance examination focusing on STEM subjects

name: Tohoku University
description: Tohoku University is known for its progressive and open approach to education, being one of the first Japanese universities to admit women. It excels in research and innovation.

name: Waseda University
tagline: Independence of Learning, Practical Utilization of Knowledge
description: Waseda University is one of Japan's most prestigious private universities with a diverse international community. It offers extensive English-taught programs and strong industry connections.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with good academic standing
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 80+ or IELTS 6.5+ for English programs

name: Keio University
description: Keio University is Japan's oldest private university with a rich history of producing leaders in business and politics. It emphasizes practical learning and global perspectives.

name: Nagoya University
description: Nagoya University is a leading national university with particular strengths in natural sciences and engineering. It has produced multiple Nobel Prize winners and emphasizes research excellence.

name: Hokkaido University
description: Hokkaido University is located in Japan's northern island and is known for its pioneering spirit and environmental research. The campus offers a unique blend of nature and academic excellence.

name: Sophia University
description: Sophia University is a private Catholic university known for its strong international programs and multilingual environment. It offers excellent liberal arts and international relations programs.
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 79+ or IELTS 6.0+ for English programs

name: University of Toronto
description: The University of Toronto is Canada's leading research university and consistently ranks among the world's top institutions. With three campuses and a diverse community, it offers exceptional programs across all disciplines.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 85% average
Specific prerequisite courses depending on program
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 100+ (22 in writing) or IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band)
otherRequirements: Personal profile and essays for certain programs

name: University of British Columbia
description: UBC is a global center for research and teaching, located in beautiful Vancouver and Kelowna. It consistently ranks among the top 40 universities worldwide and offers a transformative learning experience.
academicRequirements: High school graduation with minimum 80% average
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 90+ or IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each component)

name: McGill University
tagline: By Work, All Things Increase and Grow
description: McGill University is one of Canada's most internationally renowned universities, located in Montreal. It attracts the best students from around the world and has produced numerous Rhodes Scholars and Nobel laureates.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 85% average
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 90+ (21 in each component) or IELTS 6.5+

name: University of Alberta
tagline: Quaecumque Vera - Whatsoever Things Are True
description: The University of Alberta is one of Canada's top research universities with a focus on innovation and discovery. Located in Edmonton, it offers comprehensive programs and strong industry partnerships.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 75% average
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 90+ (21 in each band) or IELTS 6.5+ (5.5 in each band)
otherRequirements: Supplementary information form for certain programs

name: McMaster University
description: McMaster University is known for its innovative problem-based learning approach and world-class research facilities. Located in Hamilton, it excels in health sciences, engineering, and business.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 80% average
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 86+ (20 in each band) or IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band)
otherRequirements: Online personal statement for certain programs

name: University of Waterloo
description: The University of Waterloo is Canada's most innovative university and a global leader in cooperative education. It's particularly renowned for engineering, computer science, and mathematics programs.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 80-90% depending on program
Specific mathematics and science prerequisites for STEM programs
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 90+ (25 writing, 25 speaking) or IELTS 7.0+ (6.5 writing, speaking)

name: Western University
tagline: Inspiring Lives of Leadership and Purpose
description: Western University offers an exceptional student experience with strong programs in business, medicine, and social sciences. Located in London, Ontario, it provides a beautiful campus and vibrant student life.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 83% average
Six Grade 12 U or M courses including prerequisites
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 83+ (20 in each band) or IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band)

name: Queen's University
tagline: Wisdom and Knowledge Shall Be the Stability of Thy Times
description: Queen's University is a historic institution known for academic excellence and strong school spirit. Located in Kingston, it offers intimate class sizes and exceptional undergraduate education.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 80% average
Six Grade 12 courses including program-specific prerequisites
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 88+ (20 writing, 22 reading, 20 speaking, 20 listening) or IELTS 6.5+

name: Simon Fraser University
description: Simon Fraser University is a comprehensive research university with campuses across Metro Vancouver. It's known for community engagement, co-op programs, and innovative interdisciplinary education.
academicRequirements: High school graduation with minimum 70% average
Specific course prerequisites depending on program
Competitive admission requirements vary by faculty
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 88+ (20 in each component) or IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band)

name: University of Calgary
description: The University of Calgary is a comprehensive research university with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. It's particularly known for energy research, medicine, and business programs.
academicRequirements: High school diploma with minimum 75% average
Admission average varies by program competitiveness
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 86+ (20 in each band) or IELTS 6.5+

name: University of Oxford
description: The University of Oxford is the oldest university in the English-speaking world and consistently ranks among the top universities globally. It is renowned for its tutorial system and world-class research across all disciplines.
languageRequirements: TOEFL iBT 110 (min 25 Listening, 25 Reading, 25 Speaking, 24 Writing)
otherRequirements: Admissions test and interview for most courses

name: University of Cambridge
tagline: From Here, Light and Sacred Draughts
description: The University of Cambridge is one of the world's oldest and most prestigious universities, known for its rich history and academic excellence. Cambridge has produced more Nobel Prize winners than any other institution.
academicRequirements: A-levels: A*AA to A*A*A depending on course
IB: 40-42 points with 776 at Higher Level
Excellent academic record in relevant subjects

name: Imperial College London
tagline: Knowledge is the Adornment and Protection of the Empire
description: Imperial College London is a science-based institution with an international reputation for excellence in teaching and research. It focuses exclusively on science, engineering, medicine and business.
academicRequirements: A-levels: AAA to A*A*A depending on course

name: University College London
tagline: Let All Come Who By Merit Deserve The Most Reward
description: UCL is London's leading multidisciplinary university with an international reputation for the quality of its research and teaching. It was the first university in England to admit students regardless of religion or gender.
academicRequirements: A-levels: A*A*A to ABB depending on course
Strong academic performance in relevant subjects

name: University of Edinburgh
description: The University of Edinburgh is one of Scotland's ancient universities and a global leader in research and teaching. Located in Scotland's capital city, it offers a vibrant and historic learning environment.
academicRequirements: A-levels: AAA to A*A*A depending on course
Good academic standing in relevant subjects

name: King's College London
description: King's College London is one of England's oldest and most prestigious universities, renowned for its research excellence and global impact. It has a particularly strong reputation in health sciences and humanities.
academicRequirements: A-levels: A*AA to BBB depending on course

name: University of Manchester
description: The University of Manchester is a major research institution and the largest single-site university in the UK. It has a proud history of innovation and discovery, including splitting the atom.
academicRequirements: A-levels: AAA to ABB depending on course

name: London School of Economics
tagline: To Understand the Causes of Things
description: The London School of Economics specializes in social sciences and has an outstanding global reputation. It produces research and teaching in economics, politics, law, sociology and related areas.
academicRequirements: A-levels: A*AA to AAB depending on course

name: University of Warwick
description: The University of Warwick is a leading research university with an entrepreneurial approach to education. It is particularly renowned for its business school and strong industry connections.
academicRequirements: A-levels: AAA to A*A*A depending on course

name: University of Bristol
description: The University of Bristol is a research-intensive institution with a strong reputation for innovation and academic excellence. It offers a supportive learning environment in one of the UK's most vibrant cities.
academicRequirements: A-levels: AAA to A*AA depending on course

name: Australian National University
tagline: First in Australia, First for the World
description: ANU is Australia's leading university and consistently ranks among the world's top institutions. Located in the nation's capital, it offers exceptional research opportunities and a close-knit campus community.
academicRequirements: Completion of Australian Year 12 or equivalent
Specific prerequisite subjects depending on course
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 80+

name: University of Melbourne
description: The University of Melbourne is Australia's second oldest university and consistently ranks as the nation's top institution. It offers a distinctive Melbourne Model of education emphasizing breadth and depth.
academicRequirements: Completion of Year 12 or international equivalent
Prerequisite subjects as specified by course
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 79+

name: University of Sydney
tagline: The Same Yesterday, Today and Forever
description: Founded in 1850, the University of Sydney is Australia's first university and offers world-class education in a stunning sandstone campus. It combines tradition with innovation across all disciplines.
academicRequirements: Completion of secondary education equivalent to Australian Year 12
Specific subject prerequisites for certain courses
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each component) or TOEFL iBT 85+
otherRequirements: Portfolio or audition for creative arts programs

name: University of New South Wales
description: UNSW Sydney is a founding member of the Group of Eight and known for engineering, business, and law programs. It has strong industry connections and emphasizes innovation and entrepreneurship.
academicRequirements: Mathematics and science prerequisites for STEM programs
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 90+

name: University of Queensland
description: UQ is one of Australia's premier research universities with beautiful campuses in Brisbane. It excels in sciences, engineering, and business with strong emphasis on sustainability and innovation.
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 87+

name: Monash University
description: Monash is Australia's largest university with campuses across Melbourne and international locations. It's known for research excellence, particularly in medicine, engineering, and pharmacy.
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 79+

name: University of Western Australia
description: UWA is Western Australia's premier university with a stunning campus along the Swan River. It's particularly strong in mining engineering, marine science, and agricultural research.
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 82+

name: University of Adelaide
description: The University of Adelaide is a member of the Group of Eight with particular strengths in wine research, defense technology, and health sciences. It has produced five Nobel laureates.
academicRequirements: Completion of secondary education equivalent to Year 12
Specific prerequisite subjects for certain courses
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 79+

name: University of Technology Sydney
description: UTS is a dynamic young university in the heart of Sydney, known for its industry connections and practice-based learning. It excels in technology, design, and business programs.
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each component) or TOEFL iBT 79+
otherRequirements: Work experience for certain professional programs

name: Queensland University of Technology
tagline: A University for the Real World
description: QUT is known for its practical, career-oriented approach to education with strong industry partnerships. It's particularly strong in creative industries, engineering, and business.
academicRequirements: Portfolio or audition for creative programs
languageRequirements: IELTS 6.5+ (6.0 in each band) or TOEFL iBT 79+

name: Harvard University
description: Harvard University is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States and consistently ranks as one of the world's most prestigious universities. It offers unparalleled resources, research opportunities, and a diverse intellectual community.
academicRequirements: Exceptional academic record in challenging courses

name: Stanford University
description: Stanford University is a leading research institution located in the heart of Silicon Valley. It is renowned for innovation, entrepreneurship, and academic excellence across all disciplines.

name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
description: MIT is the world's premier technological university, pioneering innovation in science, technology, and engineering. It fosters entrepreneurial culture and hands-on learning through cutting-edge research.

name: California Institute of Technology
tagline: The Truth Shall Make You Free
description: Caltech is a world-renowned science and engineering institute that has been advancing human knowledge and educating future scientists and engineers. Despite its small size, it makes huge scientific and technological contributions.

name: Princeton University
description: Princeton University combines the strengths of a major research university with intimate collegiate experience. It is distinguished by its commitment to undergraduate teaching and research opportunities for all students.

name: Yale University
description: Yale University is a prestigious Ivy League institution known for its residential college system and strong liberal arts education. It offers exceptional resources and opportunities across all academic disciplines.

name: Columbia University
tagline: In Thy Light Shall We See Light
description: Columbia University is a private Ivy League research university in New York City. It offers a distinctive Core Curriculum and leverages its NYC location for unparalleled opportunities in arts, business, and culture.

name: University of Chicago
tagline: Let Knowledge Grow From More to More
description: The University of Chicago is known for its rigorous academic programs and commitment to free and open inquiry. It has a distinctive Core Curriculum and encourages intellectual exploration across disciplines.

name: University of California, Berkeley
description: UC Berkeley is a leading public research university known for its academic rigor, groundbreaking research, and social activism. It offers exceptional programs across sciences, engineering, and liberal arts.
academicRequirements: Strong performance in A-G course requirements

name: University of Pennsylvania
description: The University of Pennsylvania is an Ivy League institution known for its interdisciplinary approach and pre-professional programs. It combines liberal arts with practical application through Wharton and other specialized schools.
